info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 29 at 2:20AM EDT until July 29 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WABASH...EASTERN FULTON...SOUTHEASTERN KOSCIUSKO AND NORTHWESTERN MIAMI COUNTIES... At 220 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Mentone to 6 miles west of Mexico, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wabash, North Manchester, Akron, Mexico, Silver Lake, Erie, Denver, Roann, Claypool, Sidney, Chili, Ijamsville, Richvalley, Stockdale, Deedsville, Packerton, Laketon, Gilead, and Disko. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
